response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (20 years)", "medium", "Being young is associated with higher impulsivity and risk of recidivism, though age alone is not the strongest indicator."],
    ["Gender (male)", "medium", "Males statistically have higher rearrest rates, contributing moderately to recidivism risk."],
    ["Race (identifies as Black)", "low", "While race is not a causal factor, systemic biases might affect outcomes; however, it is not a direct criminogenic factor."],
    ["Criminal history (4 arrests and conviction)", "high", "A significant history of arrests and convictions strongly correlates with future offending."],
    ["Height (6 feet 6 inches)", "low", "Height is generally not relevant to criminal behavior or risk assessment."],
    ["Marital status (never married, living alone)", "medium", "Lack of stable social support from close relationships may increase risk, though it is not determinative alone."],
    ["Educational attainment (no high school diploma/GED, not enrolled in college)", "high", "Lack of educational achievement is linked with fewer opportunities and increased risk of recidivism."],
    ["Employment status (no job in the past year)", "high", "Unemployment is a strong risk factor as it can lead to economic and social stress associated with reoffending."],
    ["Substance use (recent marijuana use)", "medium", "Substance use can impair judgment and is commonly associated with criminal behavior, though marijuana alone is less potent than harder drugs."],
    ["Depressive symptoms (feeling down some of the time in the past month)", "medium", "Mental health issues can contribute to criminal behavior indirectly, increasing risk through poor coping mechanisms."],
    ["Family background (lived in a large household at a young age)", "low", "While larger households can sometimes mean reduced supervision, this factor is relatively minor without further context."],
    ["Spirituality/religiosity (believes God has nothing to do with his personal fate)", "medium", "Lack of religious or spiritual support may remove a protective social factor, contributing moderately to risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 85
}

risk_factors: Being young is associated with higher impulsivity and risk of recidivism, though age alone is not the strongest indicator.
Males statistically have higher rearrest rates, contributing moderately to recidivism risk.
While race is not a causal factor, systemic biases might affect outcomes; however, it is not a direct criminogenic factor.
A significant history of arrests and convictions strongly correlates with future offending.
Height is generally not relevant to criminal behavior or risk assessment.
Lack of stable social support from close relationships may increase risk, though it is not determinative alone.
Educational attainment (no high school diploma/GED, not enrolled in college)
Lack of educational achievement is linked with fewer opportunities and increased risk of recidivism.
Employment status (no job in the past year)
Unemployment is a strong risk factor as it can lead to economic and social stress associated with reoffending.
Substance use can impair judgment and is commonly associated with criminal behavior, though marijuana alone is less potent than harder drugs.
Depressive symptoms (feeling down some of the time in the past month)
Mental health issues can contribute to criminal behavior indirectly, increasing risk through poor coping mechanisms.
Family background (lived in a large household at a young age)
While larger households can sometimes mean reduced supervision, this factor is relatively minor without further context.
Spirituality/religiosity (believes God has nothing to do with his personal fate)
Lack of religious or spiritual support may remove a protective social factor, contributing moderately to risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 20-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 4 times and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 6 inches. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived in a household of size 7. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
